{"step_by_step_thinking": "The ratio of the number of deaths under 1 year of age to the total live births per 1000 live births per year is known as the infant mortality rate. This rate specifically focuses on deaths that occur within the first year of life. Child mortality rate refers to the number of deaths among children aged 1 to 5 years. Child morbidity rate refers to the prevalence of illness or disease among children. Life expectancy rate refers to the average number of years a person is expected to live based on current mortality rates.", "answer_choice": "A. Infant mortality rate"}
